header.text: I discovered my passion for web design and development at the age of 14. During my apprenticeship, also known by the nickname "Master Bling-Bling", my urge to delve deeper and deeper into the subject grew. Growing up during the time of mobile change helped me. So "mobile first" and "responsive design" are not foreign words, but part of the standard.

ux.title: Web development with focus on UI/UX design
ux.text: Web applications and websites should be developed as simply as possible for different user groups. I'm no stranger to A/B tests and user group analysis, and they're as much a part of front-end development as programming itself.

testing.title: Test-driven development
testing.text: Red and green are not just traffic light colours for me, but a support for the development of qualitative software. That's why I rely mainly on Jest and Cypress for web applications.

design-system.title: Implementation of design systems
design-system.text: In order to give users the same feeling as possible about software, I develop design systems with the help of Storybook. I use the concept of Atomic Design to make elements reusable but flexible.

technologies.title: My technologies
technologies.text: To achieve the best possible result, I always use the appropriate technology. In doing so, I can draw on a large portfolio of knowledge.

design.title: Handmade components
design.text: Every website needs its own style, so the elements of my portfolio are all self-developed and not based on common component libraries. To speed up the development of the individual components, I have been using TailwindCSS for many years. On the following pages I explain what I thought about when designing the individual elements. The source code is of course publicly available on GitHub.
